entries.summary: Institution acts as sponsor; acceptance letter, medical test, Emirates ID, health insurance required.

financial.text: Bank statements (3-6 months) or sponsor letter; fees and insurance (see notes)

application_steps: 1) Get admission 2) University/sponsor initiates visa 3) Medical tests 4) Emirates ID issuance
entries.fees: Visa app 3,000–3,500 AED; Renewal 2,000–2,500 AED; Medical 300–500 AED; Emirates ID 370–400 AED
entries.work_rights: Conditional; requires permission and sponsor/university approval
entries.scholarships: University-specific scholarships; Abu Dhabi Golden Visa for high achievers
entries.notes: Most documents arranged via university PRO; check institution pages for exact amounts and processes.

entries.summary: F-1 requires I-20 from SEVP-certified school, SEVIS fee, DS-160, consulate interview and proof of funds.
entries.language_tests: Depends on institution (TOEFL/IELTS commonly used for admissions)

financial.text: Proof of funds covering tuition + living for first year; amounts vary by school

application_steps: 1) Apply & get I-20 2) Pay SEVIS fee 3) Complete DS-160 4) Schedule consulate interview

processing_time.text: Varies by consulate; weeks to months

entries.fees: Visa application fee ~USD 185; SEVIS I-901 fee USD 350 (approx)
entries.notes: Non-immigrant intent is assessed at consulate interview; SEVP/I-20 central to process.

entries.summary: Study permit for Designated Learning Institutions; recent PAL/TAL attestation requirement (2024); proof of funds required.

financial.text: Proof of tuition + living (approx CAD 20,635 for single student as per report)

entries.fees: Biometrics fee CAD 85; other application fees vary
entries.work_rights: Post-Graduation Work Permit available (PGWP) with eligibility restrictions
entries.notes: 2024 policy changes introduced PAL/TAL; verify province-specific rules with provincial portals.

entries.visa_type: National Student Visa / Student Applicant Visa
entries.summary: Non-EU students need national visa; commonly required blocked account (Sperrkonto) showing €11,904/year (as of 2025).
entries.language_tests: TestDaF, DSH or Goethe-Zertifikat for German-taught; IELTS often for English-taught programs
application_steps: open blocked account or submit commitment
entries.work_rights: 140 full days or 280 half days per year (~20 hours/week)
entries.notes: Blocked account requirement updated Jan 1, 2025; also Student Applicant Visa exists for preparatory stays.

entries.visa_type: VLS-TS (Long-stay student visa serving as residence permit)
entries.summary: VLS-TS serves as visa+residence permit; validate online after arrival; financial proof ~€615/month for first year.
entries.language_tests: TCF/DELF for French-taught; English-taught may accept IELTS/TOEFL (varies)

financial.text: €615 per month (~€7,380 for first year) as per report

application_steps: validate VLS-TS online within 3 months of arrival
entries.notes: Campus France streamlines many application steps; validation online replaces older OFII step.

entries.summary: Points-based Student Visa requires CAS from sponsor, English level, and financial proof; pay IHS and visa fee.
entries.language_tests: CEFR B2 level typically (IELTS ~5.5–6.0 for many courses)

financial.text: First year's tuition + 9 months living costs (amount varies by location; London higher)

processing_time.text: Varies by location; consulate processing times

entries.fees: Visa fee ~£524 (non-UK applicants) + Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS)
entries.notes: CAS digital reference critical; IHS depends on visa length.

entries.visa_type: MVV (Entry Visa) and VVR (Residence Permit) / Student Residence Permit
entries.summary: Recognized Sponsor model: university applies on student's behalf; must show satisfactory study progress; work limits apply.
entries.language_tests: Varies by program; English or Dutch test depending on language of instruction

financial.text: Proof of sufficient funds; amounts vary by programme and IND guidance

entries.work_rights: 16 hrs/week during term or full-time in June-August
entries.scholarships: Study in NL information packages & scholarships
entries.notes: Universities as Recognized Sponsors handle most application steps; satisfactory progress requirement enforced.

entries.summary: Genuine Student (GS) test required; higher financial benchmarks and application fee (AUD 2,000 as of July 2025).
entries.language_tests: IELTS/PTE/TOEFL commonly accepted (typical scores: UG 6.0, PG 6.5)

financial.text: Evidence of funds including AUD 29,710 living expenses (per report)

entries.fees: Visa fee AUD 2,000 (from July 1, 2025 per report)
entries.work_rights: 48 hours per fortnight while in session
entries.notes: Genuine Student test replaces older GTE; fee and living cost updates noted for 2025.

entries.summary: Pathway Student Visa allows up to three consecutive programs on a single visa; living fund requirement NZD 20,000/year.
entries.language_tests: Varies by institution; English proficiency typically required

financial.text: Living fund NZD 20,000 per year (per report)

entries.notes: Pathway visa useful for sequential study programs; living fund estimates provided in report.

entries.summary: SOLAR system: university registers student, student completes eForm; processing often 1–2 weeks.
entries.fees: Processing fee S$45; Issuance fee S$60 (per report)
entries.work_rights: Limited; subject to MOM rules and institution
entries.scholarships: University scholarships and Singapore government schemes
entries.notes: Efficient processing via SOLAR; issuance fees listed in report.

entries.summary: Certificate of Eligibility (CoE) required; schools act as proxy to apply for CoE; financial proof ~JPY 3,000,000 for first year (per report).
entries.language_tests: Varies by program (Japanese proficiency for Japanese-taught; English tests for English-taught)

financial.text: Approx JPY 3,000,000 (~USD 20,000) for first year per report

application_steps: School submits CoE application to Regional Immigration Bureau
on CoE issuance student applies for visa at embassy
entries.work_rights: Limited; permission required for part-time work
entries.notes: Financial amount is an approximate figure quoted in report; confirm with embassy/university.
